basics.name: Jonathan Cheng
basics.label: Full-Stack Developer
basics.summary: Dynamic web developer transitioning from a background in social media  and journalism within the sports industry. I wanted to build platforms that are robust and easy to use for consumers. With this passion, I completed my Full Stack Web Development Diploma where I was able to learn fundamentals to bring my vision into reality.

work.name: League1 Ontario
work.summary: Coordinate efficient setup of operations at soccer matches, and communicating with teams and officials to ensure league rules are followed to facilitate a smooth match-day experience.
highlights: Directed social media team in events for 20,000 followers
Oversaw operations of 92 matches in three seasons

work.name: Independent
work.summary: Captured compelling storylines into words and photos while managing multiple media projects and meeting time-sensitive deadlines in high-pressure environments.
highlights: Published feature stories of athletes on multiple platforms
Won Centennial's CLIX photography competition in 2017

education.area:
Double Major in Criminology and Sociology
Certificate in Writing

projects.name: L1O-stats
projects.description: Stats tracker and Twitter-graphic generator for League1 Ontario to create graphics that meet WCAG 2 Contrast and Colour accessibility requirements.

projects.name: ez-league
projects.description: Sports-league generator with real-time stats tracking and schedules, recreating a professional feel for amateur leagues.

projects.name: Jungle
projects.description: Mini e-commerce application built on Ruby on Rails 4.2 that uses Stripe to process mock orders.
